Description: Typical range for 1064 nm Nd:YAG lasers in metal cleaning to balance efficiency and heat input; starting at 150 W for Beryllium due to high reflectivity (~70% at 1064 nm) reducing absorption; max avoids substrate melting (1287°C) per studies on reflective metals (e.g., SPIE Proc. Vol. 10912, 2019). Source: IPG Photonics YLR series specs.
Near-IR wavelength optimized for Beryllium thermal absorption characteristics
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning control
High repetition rate for efficient cleaning with minimal thermal damage
Nanosecond pulse duration for controlled ablation of surface contaminants
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Number of cleaning passes for complete contaminant removal
Beam overlap percentage for uniform cleaning pattern
